title: Conflict of interest row as ex-HS2 executives sign up with consultancy advising the project
text:
A consultancy advising the Government on HS2 is under fire for hiring senior employees from the high-speed rail project to assist its work.

Simon Kirby and Stewart Westgate are among former HS2 bosses employed by Nichols Group, a consultancy advising on the £88bn scheme.

Representatives from Nichols said that the firm had behaved in accordance with Government rules and that neither Mr Kirby or Mr Westgate had had any involvement with HS2 since leaving the company. Their employment was first report by the Financial Times.

A Nichols spokesman said: “We conduct ourselves by the highest ethical and professional standards and are proud of the work we do to make these vital projects happen.
